section.title: One or Two Controller Node Disaster Recovery
section.para: This scenario makes the following assumptions:

listitem.para: Your lifecycle manager is still intact and working.
One or two of your controller nodes went down, but not the entire cluster.
The node needs to be rebuilt from scratch, not simply rebooted.

sidebar.title: Steps to recovering one or two controller nodes

listitem.para: Ensure that your node has power and all of the hardware is functioning.
Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Verify that all of the information in your ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file is correct for your controller node. You may need to replace the existing information if you had to either replacement your entire controller node or just pieces of it.
If you made changes to your servers.yml file then commit those changes to your local git:
listitem.screen: git add -A git commit -a -m "editing controller information"

listitem.para: Ensure that Cobbler has the correct system information:
If you replaced your controller node with a completely new machine, you need to verify that Cobbler has the correct list of controller nodes:
Remove any controller nodes from Cobbler that no longer exist:
Add the new node into Cobbler:
Then you can image the node:

Before proceeding, you may want to take a look at info/server_info.yml to see if the assignment of the node you have added is what you expect. It may not be, as nodes will not be numbered consecutively if any have previously been removed. This is to prevent loss of data; the config processor retains data about removed nodes and keeps their ID numbers from being reallocated. See the Persisted Server Allocations section in for information on how this works.
[OPTIONAL] - Run the wipe_disks.yml playbook to ensure all of your partitions on your nodes are completely wiped prior to continuing with the installation:
Complete the rebuilding of your controller node with the two playbooks below:
listitem.screen: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts osconfig-run.yml -e rebuild=True --limit=<controller_node_hostname> ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-deploy.yml -e rebuild=True --limit=<controller_node_hostname>
